**Tech Updates: Interesting Developments**

Here are brief highlights from recent news:

*   **FreeBSD VPS Powers Global Weather Service:** [FediMeteo](https://it-notes.dragas.net/2025/02/26/fedimeteo-how-a-tiny-freebsd-vps-became-a-global-weather-service-for-thousands/) demonstrates how lightweight systems can achieve impressive results.
*   **Toro Enables Unikernel Apps:** [Toro](https://github.com/torokernel/torokernel) allows deploying applications as highly optimized unikernels directly onto hardware hypervisors.
*   **Electrolysis for Pollution Control:** ETH Zurich researchers suggest [Electrolysis](https://ethz.ch/en/news-and-events/eth-news/news/2025/11/electrolysis-can-solve-one-of-our-biggest-contamination-problems.html) could be a key solution for tackling major contamination issues.
*   **Libsodium Security Flaw:** A vulnerability in the popular [cryptography library Libsodium](https://00f.net/2025/12/30/libsodium-vulnerability/) has been reported. (Note: Link provided points to a specific announcement, not necessarily an authoritative source).
*   **Loss32.org Platform:** The domain [Loss32](https://loss32.org/) aims to build and provide tools for Win32/Linux compatibility or development.

These updates cover innovations in system efficiency and deployment, environmental solutions, security vulnerabilities, and platform-related projects.
